text: Elections to Rochford Council were held on 1 May 2003. One third of the council was up for election and the Conservative party stayed in overall control of the council. After the election, the composition of the council was: {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Party!!Seats!! ± |- |style="background-color: " | |Conservative || 30 || +2 |- |style="background- color: " | |Liberal Democrat || 4 || 0 |- |style="background-color: " | |Labour || 3 || -1 |- |style="background-color: " | |Independent || 1 || -1 |- |style="background-color: " | |Hawkwell Residents || 1 || 0 |} ==Election result== ==Ward results== ===Ashingdon and Canewdon=== ===Barling and Sutton=== ===Downhall and Rawreth=== ===Foulness and Great Wakering=== ===Grange=== ===Hawkwell North=== ===Hawkwell South=== ===Hawkwell West=== ===Hockley Central=== ===Hullbridge=== ===Lodge=== ===Rochford=== ===Sweyne Park=== ==References== *2003 Rochford election result *Ward results 2003 Category:2003 English local elections Category:2000s in Essex
title: 2003 Rochford District Council election
